results.title: An Inscrutable Monarch, Endlessly Scrutinized Onstage and Onscreen
results.abstract: Queen Elizabeth II was portrayed in plays and highbrow films, in made-for-TV movies and broad comedies and, of course, in “The Crown.” Many sought to answer the question: What was she like?
per_facet: Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

multimedia.caption: Many distinguished actors have taken on the role of Queen Elizabeth II over the years, including Helen Mirren in Stephen Frears’s 2006 film “The Queen.”
Many distinguished actors have taken on the role of Queen Elizabeth II over the years, including Helen Mirren in Stephen Frears’s 2006 film “The Queen.”
Many distinguished actors have taken on the role of Queen Elizabeth II over the years, including Helen Mirren in Stephen Frears’s 2006 film “The Queen.”

results.title: When Weird Al Yankovic Met Daniel Radcliffe, Things Got … Well, You Know
results.abstract: For their decidedly nonfactual rock biopic, the pop-music parodist and the “Harry Potter” star found themselves on the same wavelength.

multimedia.caption: “I’m amazed the lawyers let us get away with this movie, frankly,” Yankovic said.

results.title: A Movie House Divided
results.abstract: As the fall film season begins and the midterm elections loom, our chief critics ponder the state of democracy, onscreen and off.
results.byline: By A.O. Scott and Manohla Dargis

results.title: ‘Hold Me Tight’ Review: An Étude in the Key of Grief
results.abstract: In Mathieu Amalric’s new film, Vicky Krieps plays a mother who tries to stay close to her family by running away.

multimedia.caption: In “Hold Me Tight,” Clarisse (Vicky Krieps) drives away from her family, leaving her husband and children behind.
In “Hold Me Tight,” Clarisse (Vicky Krieps) drives away from her family, leaving her husband and children behind.

results.abstract: This live action and animated reimagining of the classic fairy tale takes too much time relaying its narrative.

results.abstract: A woman tries to keep her family business running in this film that employs dreamlike rhythms and documentary-style realism.

results.title: What it was like to portray the queen onscreen.

results.title: ‘The Woman King’ and Intimate Moments Amid Epic Action
results.abstract: The director Gina Prince-Bythewood is known for her attention to character, but she made this historic saga of female warriors on another scale altogether.

multimedia.caption: The more Gina Prince-Bythewood learned about the Agojie army, “the more I got excited about putting this incredible culture — and us — onscreen in a way that we haven’t been able to see ourselves.”
multimedia.copyright: Erik Carter for The New York Times

results.title: Regal Cinemas’ parent, crippled by the pandemic, files for bankruptcy.

results.title: When George Clooney Met Julia Roberts (Don’t Believe the Reports)
results.abstract: For their latest big-screen partnership, they play exes who take shots at each other. It’s not such a stretch to the fond insults they sling in real life.
